page.title: 09WALKS AROUND MADELEY
page.content: In 1984, Mr George Riley's booklet 'Five Walks around Madeley' was publi- shed. It demonstrates the variety and interest there is in walking as a major recreational activity. All of the walks begin near to Madeley Church. The walks vary in length from 4 to 7 miles with never more than 1.5 miles of road walk- ing. Most of the walks are across fields, sometimes revealing old foot- paths or a wagon track from 100 years in the past. The walks are across some very attractive countryside, with some superb views. There are other public rights of way in the area, but these are good examples. Some of the places that can be reached by using the guide include the villages of Aston, Baldwins Gate, Betley, Onneley and Keele and the M6 Motorway. Quite a lot of village pubs could provide refreshments.
